Viewing Files Horizontally, Vertically, or Together

In Visual Diff, you can view the files you are comparing vertically, horizontally, or together in one window. The application remembers your last choice and displays files that way the next time you make a comparison.

To view the files side-by-side:

Do one of the following:

  • Select Window > Split Vertically from the menu.

  • Click the Split Vertically button on the toolbar.

  • Double-click the vertical splitter bar.

  • Drag the vertical splitter bar to a location within the window. This bar appears to the left of the horizontal scroll bar.

To view the files top-and-bottom:

Do one of the following:

  • Select Window > Split Horizontally from the menu.

  • Click the Split Horizontally button on the toolbar.

  • Double-click the horizontal splitter bar.

  • Drag the horizontal splitter bar to a location within the window. This bar is just above the vertical scroll bar.

To combine the files:

Do one of the following:

  • Select Window > Show Together from the menu.

  • Click the Show Together button on the toolbar.

  • Drag the splitter bar to the edge of the window.

To adjust the window space allocated for each file:

    Drag the splitter bar that separates the two files. Visual Diff remembers the bar’s last vertical and last horizontal locations and uses the appropriate location when you split the screen.
